item.title: Body of Italian Man Missing in Egypt Found With Signs of Torture
item.description: The discovery of Giulio Regeni, 28, a Ph.D. student who was doing field research, prompted anger in Italy, which has called for a joint investigation.
item.dc:creator: DECLAN WALSH
item.media:description: Police officers on Thursday guarding the Cairo morgue where the body of the Italian student Giulio Regeni is being kept.

item.title: GPS Mix-Up Brings Wrong Turn, and Celebrity, to an American in Iceland
item.description: Noel Santillan, a 28-year-old from New Jersey, typed the wrong address for his hotel and spent six hours on the road before realizing: This isn’t Reykjavik.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: Editorial: A New Chance for Gay Rights in India
item.description: An unjust, colonial-era law could soon be consigned to history.
item.dc:creator: THE EDITORIAL BOARD

item.title: Xi Jinping Assuming New Status as China’s ‘Core’ Leader
item.description: The term evokes a stature not recognized since Deng Xiaoping and suggests that President Xi’s steely quest for dominance is not over.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: President Xi Jinping of China at a medal ceremony in September for the 70th anniversary of the end of World War II.

item.title: North Korea Launches Newest Offensive: Cigarette Butts
item.description: Balloons sent by the North carried not just leaflets declaring South Korea’s leader a “filthy president,” but also a payload of actual filth.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:description: South Korean soldiers patrolling the border with North Korea. Both countries have escalated their propaganda war across the heavily armed border since the North’s latest nuclear test.

item.title: Germany Arrests Algerian Suspected of Planning Terrorist Attack
item.description: The Berlin police said the man, 35, was detained at a refugee shelter after hundreds of officers carried out raids across three states.
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: German police officers arrested a suspect in Berlin during antiterrorism raids on Thursday.

item.title: Op-Ed Columnist: Europe's Huddled Masses
item.description: A digital migration of epic proportions is underway. But America is nowhere to be seen on the refugee crisis.
item.dc:creator: ROGER COHEN

item.title: John Kerry Calls on Russia to Honor Syria Airstrike Resolution
item.description: The secretary of state applied pressure to Russia on airstrikes and humanitarian access a day after peace talks were halted abruptly in Geneva.
item.dc:creator: JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry, right, and Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond of Britain in London on Thursday.

item.title: Julian Assange to ‘Accept Arrest’ if U.N. Panel Rules Against Him
item.description: The founder of WikiLeaks said he would turn himself in if the panel ruled that his years at the Ecuadorean Embassy in London did not constitute illegal imprisonment.
item.dc:creator: LIAM STACK and SEWELL CHAN
item.media:description: The British police kept a 24-hour watch outside the Ecuadorean Embassy for several years, but ended the arrangement in October after having spent more than $17 million.

item.title: Obama Is Pressed to Open Military Front Against ISIS in Libya
item.description: The number of Islamic State fighters in Libya has grown to between 5,000 and 6,500, Pentagon officials said, more than double the estimate of last fall.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Zubaydi, Wissam Najm Abd Zayd al
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ERIC SCHMITT
item.media:description: Militia fighters aligned with the forces that took over the government in Tripoli, Libya, fired an artillery piece at Islamic State militants near Surt last year.

item.title: Geneva Journal: As Syria Talks Fizzle, ‘War Has No Meaning Anymore’
item.description: Much in Geneva this week was like the last round of Syria peace talks there two years ago. But something fundamental had changed: There was, on both sides, grim resignation.
item.dc:creator: ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: Demonstrators protested the Syrian government outside the United Nations headquarters in Geneva last week. Some were recent refugees, having fled to Europe since the last round of talks two years ago.

item.title: world briefing: Mexico: Ex-Governor Detained by Spain Returns Home
item.description: The former governor, Humberto Moreira, spent a week in a Spanish jail on suspicion of money laundering last month and flew back to Mexico on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETH MALKIN

item.title: world briefing: Iraq: Baghdad to Get a Security Wall and Trench
item.description: The construction will be an effort to prevent militant attacks and reduce the large number of checkpoints inside the city.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Activity at North Korea Site Suggests Preparations for Rocket Launch
item.description: More vehicles have been seen at a launch site near Pyongyang’s northwestern border with China, according to a United States website.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:description: Satellite imagery dated Jan. 25, 2016, showed three objects at the base of the gantry tower that were either vehicles or equipment at the Tongchang-ri launch site in North Korea.

item.title: World Briefing: Iran: Former BBC Journalist Is Arrested
item.description: The former journalist, Bahman Daroshafaei, a dual citizen of Britain and Iran, was taken into custody for undisclosed reasons in Tehran, where he had been working as a translator.
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Blood Banks Use Caution With Travelers From Zika Zones
item.description: Potential donors are being asked not to give blood if within the last month they have visited a country in which the Zika virus is spreading.
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
item.dc:creator: CATHERINE SAINT LOUIS

item.title: Birth Defects in Brazil May Be Over-Reported Amid Zika Fears
item.description: After many false alarms, the government is considering tightening the guidelines establishing when health care providers should report infants born with abnormally small heads.
item.dc:creator: VINOD SREEHARSHA
item.media:description: An infant with microcephaly was bathed Monday in Recife, Brazil. Among the 404 confirmed microcephaly cases since October, 17 have tested positive for Zika.

item.title: Syria Peace Talks Are Suspended
item.description: The United Nations mediator, Staffan de Mistura, announced that he was halting the talks until Feb. 25 because of a lack of progress.
item.dc:creator: NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:description: Staffan de Mistura, the United Nations special envoy for Syria, in Geneva on Wednesday, before suspending talks until Feb. 25.

item.title: Iowa Votes, and the World Weighs In
item.description: What do they make of the caucus results in Hong Kong? Egypt? And Mexico? (Donald Trump may want to skip these last two.)
item.dc:creator: THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:credit: Eric Thayer for The New York Times
item.media:description: Voting at a Republican caucus in Pella, Iowa, on Monday.

item.title: Israeli Police Officer Is Killed in Attack by 3 Palestinians in Jerusalem
item.description: Another border police officer was wounded in the assault, carried out by men armed with automatic rifles, knives and pipe bombs, who were fatally shot by officers at the scene.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: Israeli investigators on Wednesday near the body of a Palestinian who was killed after he and two others attacked border police officers in East Jerusalem.
